org.apache.sysds.runtime.compress.estim

Class CompressedSizeEstimator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.sysds.runtime.compress.estim.CompressedSizeEstimator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompressedSizeEstimatorExact, CompressedSizeEstimatorSample

    public abstract class CompressedSizeEstimator
extends Object
    Main abstract class for estimating size of compressions on columns.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • computeCompressedSizeInfos

        public CompressedSizeInfo computeCompressedSizeInfos(int k)
        Multi threaded version of extracting Compression Size info
        Parameters:
        k - The concurrency degree.
        Returns:
        The Compression Size info of each Column compressed isolated.

      • estimateCompressedColGroupSize

        public CompressedSizeInfoColGroup estimateCompressedColGroupSize()
        Method used for compressing into one type of colGroup
        Returns:
        CompressedSizeInfo on a compressed colGroup compressing the entire matrix into a single colGroup type.

      • estimateCompressedColGroupSize

        public abstract CompressedSizeInfoColGroup estimateCompressedColGroupSize(int[] colIndexes)
        Abstract method for extracting Compressed Size Info of specified columns, together in a single ColGroup
        Parameters:
        colIndexes - The Colums to group together inside a ColGroup
        Returns:
        The CompressedSizeInformation associated with the selected ColGroups.

      • estimateCompressedColGroupSize

        public EstimationFactors estimateCompressedColGroupSize(ABitmap ubm)
        Method used to extract the CompressedSizeEstimationFactors from an constructed UncompressedBitmap. Note this method works both for the sample based estimator and the exact estimator, since the bitmap, can be extracted from a sample or from the entire dataset.
        Parameters:
        ubm - the UncompressedBitmap, either extracted from a sample or from the entier dataset
        Returns:
        The size factors estimated from the Bit Map.
